Vidala's Rig

General Notes[edit]

Vidala's Rig is designed for the Amazon, with a bow in it, but as with all the item sets with a weapon, the damage is too low.

Vidala's Snare was originally a ring, but was changed to an amulet during the Diablo II Stress Test, and the Clvl requirement increased from 9 to 14 at the same time.

These are the stats for the set in Diablo II Expansion Pack: Lord of Destruction, where there are partial set bonuses and hidden item bonuses.

  • Item level (ilvl): Used in many in-game calculations. Monsters must be of this level to drop the item.
  • Character level (clvl): The character level you need to be to be able to wear or equip the item.
  • Hidden bonuses stack together. For instance, if an item has a bonus for two items and a bonus for three items, and three items are worn, both the bonus for two items and for three items will become active.
  • It is possible to gamble Set and Unique items in v1.09+. The odds are roughly 1/1000 for Set items and 1/2000 for Unique items.
  • Items with Rarity are expressed as a chance out of 1000. IE 78/1000 would mean that out of every 1000 set items of that base item that drop, 78 of them will be this particular one.

Weapon Notes[edit]

  • Damage Bonus: This determines how you multiply the item damage by your stats to reach the actual damage. Multiply by the listed value per 100 points in that stat. All bows are 100 Dex, almost all melee weapons are 100 Str, most throwing weapons are 50/50.
  • Weapon Speed: A relative comparison to other weapons of the same type. 0 is the base -10, -20, etc is faster, 10, 20, etc is slower, always in increments of 10. Each 10 is equivalent to an SIAS item. Previously items were listed with WSM modified by IAS on the items, we have revised this to show the Weapons base speed (WSM) before ANY IAS.
  • Range: Relevant to melee weapons only. From 1 (least) to 5 (most) in D2X. Numbers are fixed across item classes: a 3 javelin = a 3 sword = a 3 hammer, etc.

Armor Notes[edit]

  • Light Armor: 0% stamina drain and speed penalty.
  • Medium Armor: +50% stamina drain and 5% speed penalty.
  • Heavy Armor: +100% stamina drain and 10% speed penalty.

Set Bonuses[edit]

This would be another set without enough damage to be very usable even if the set bonus weren't bugged. Ranged attacks in Diablo II can never freeze the target, so the best aspect of this one is useless. If it worked this would be a usable set for Bowazons even with the very low damage, just to not have any worry about corpses and to be able to stop any attacker in their tracks.

Set Attributes/Bonus Item Slots Used Item Slots Free
Partial Set Bonuses:
Wearing 2 Items: 75 to Attack Rating
Wearing 3 Items: 15 to Dexterity

Full Set Bonus:
15-20 Cold Damage, 2 Second Cold Duration
Hit Freezes Target 1
50% Chance to Pierce Target

Diablo II[edit]

These are the stats for the set in Diablo II, where there are no partial set bonuses or hidden item bonuses.

Item Item Name Attributes Commentary
Vidala's Snare
Amulet 		Cold Resist 20%
15 To Life
Clvl Req: 14 		Not bad stats for an amulet with only two modifiers on it. Of course not many characters use magical amulets.
Vidala's Ambush
Leather Armor 		64-67 Defense
48 Durability
14 Str Required
50 Defense
11 to Dexterity
Clvl Req: 14 		Not bad stats if you have it early on, before you find better armor. It's also nice if you get it in a gamble, as it's one of the very few profits you make gambling, with a sell price higher than the gamble price.
Vidala's Fetlock
Light Plated Boots 		9-11 Defense
30 Durability
50 Str Required
Fastest Run/Walk
150 to Maximum Stamina
Clvl Req: 14 		One of the most popular set items, these are used even late in the game by characters who need fastest run for a long time from their boots.
Vidala's Barb
Long Battle Bow 		3-18 Damage
50 Dex Required
40 Str Required
Attack Speed:
A/B - Very Fast
S/N/P - Fast
Adds 1-20 Lightning Damage
Clvl Req: 14 		No damage bonus, and 1-20 lightning damage added isn't enough to matter after the early stages of the game.

Set Bonuses[edit]

This would be another set without enough damage to be very usable even if the set bonus weren't bugged. Ranged attacks in Diablo II can never freeze the target, so the best aspect of this one is useless. If it worked this would be a usable set for Bowazons even with the very low damage, just to not have any worry about corpses and to be able to stop any attacker in their tracks.
